Detailed Description

Access a sequence generator in the database.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

◆ Sequence()

storage::ittiadb::Sequence::Sequence ( Connection &  connection,
const char *  name 
)

Create an object to access a sequence in the database.

Parameters
connectionA database connection object. The connection must be opened before any member functions can be used.
nameSequence name. A name must start with a letter and can be followed by one or more letters, numbers, or underscores.

Member Function Documentation

◆ exists()

bool storage::ittiadb::Sequence::exists ( )

Determines whether the sequence exists in the database.

Returns
  • true if the sequence exists.
  • false if the sequence does not exist.

◆ open()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Sequence::open ( )
inline

Open the sequence.

Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid database handle.
    • DB_ENAME Invalid name.

◆ close()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Sequence::close ( )
inline

Closes the sequence generator.

Returns
  • DB_OK When successful

  • DB_FAIL On failure

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Invalid sequence handle.

◆ is_open()

bool storage::ittiadb::Sequence::is_open ( ) const
inline

Checks if the sequence is open.

Returns
  • true if the sequence is open
  • false if the sequence is not open

◆ get_next_value()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Sequence::get_next_value ( db_seqvalue_t &  value)
inline

Obtain the next value from a sequence.

Parameters
valueReturned value.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Casued by: invalid sequence handle.
    • DB_ESEQ_OVERFLOW Sequence overflow: no unique values remain.

◆ get_current_value()

db_result_t storage::ittiadb::Sequence::get_current_value ( db_seqvalue_t &  value)
inline

Obtain the current value of a sequence.

Parameters
valueReturned value.
Returns
  • DB_OK when successful.

  • DB_FAIL on failure.

    On failure, one of the following error codes is set:

    • DB_EINVAL Casued by: invalid sequence handle.
